titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:50

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, writings, photographs, ephemera, and posters relating to the history of the Gold Coast (now known as Ghana) and the current political, economic, and social conditions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ghana Collection (MS 1519). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection, MS 605; African Postcard Collection, MS 1575, Pamphlet Collection, MS 1351. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in the original accession is arranged chronologically, with photographs last. Additions to the collection may vary in arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, writings, photographs, ephemera, and posters relating to the history of the Gold Coast (now known as Ghana) and the current political, economic, and social conditions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

odd.head: General
odd.p: "Gold Coast Sponsors Group of the Ghana Congress Party: documents; letters; reports; lists of autographs, 1952-1954" (formerly box 1, folder 12) is missing from the collection as of 2014.

did.unittitle: Gold Coast Constabulary: papers relating to Assistant Inspector Frederick A. Fenton of the White Volta District
Gold Coast Government Railways: first class free pass issued to Lieutenant W. G. Kettle; map of the railway; photographs taken by Kettle during survey of proposed new line from Kumasi to Accra
Education: school bulletins, pamphlets, printed material
The Gold Coast Handbook : produced in England by the authority of the publishers, the Gold Coast Government
Letters and photographs sent by Sonja and Janje Wyllie to Helen and Adelbert Poka-Pivny regarding their stay in Ghana and the birth of their son, Janik
Castles and forts of the Gold Coast: calendar
Obituaries; funeral orations of political and tribal figures
"Tradition and Change - Problems of Progress," by Russell Warren Howe
Political organizations: journals; newsletters; printed material
State Shipping Corporation: reports on the Black Star Line
Royal Air Force during World War II: photograph album and loose photographs
Village life: photographs by Robert S. Boyd
Photograph album of Harold J. Cox
West African Cocoa , Anglo-Guinea Produce Co., Ltd.
"Rebuilding the National Economy": broadcast speech of the National Liberation Council

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This material is arranged alphabetically by title and/or personal name. Photographs and a drawing are at the end of the accession.

did.unittitle: "Code of Conduct for Political Parties in Ghana"
"Fighting Words, Proverbs in Asafo Flags of Ghana," program for an exhibit at The Textile Museum, Washington, D.C.
GBC Radio and TV Times , vol. 21, no. 2
GJA (Ghana Journalists Association) Guidelines on Election Coverage
Institute of Current World Affairs, reports by Peter Bird Martin on the economy of Ghana
Labour, Ghana Trade Union Congress (TUC ), vol. 1, nos. 1, 4
Nkrumah, Dr. Kwame (Osagyefo), president of the Republic of Ghana
Address at the opening of the Accra Assembly (two copies, one annotated)
Press release of 1963 May Day broadcast
"A Social Democratic Agenda for Ghana, the Philosophy of the National Democratic Congress"
"Special Commemorative Brochure for the 25thAnniversary of Odeneho Oduro Numapau II (Essumejahene and Omanhene of Essumeja Traditional Area, 1975-2000)"
Talking Drums , vol. 1, no. 43, vol. 2, no.14
"Voice of African Workers," Organization of African Trade Union Unity
"White Paper on the Report of the Commission of Inquiry into the Yendi Disturbances of 25-27 March, 2002," Republic of Ghana
Photographs, nine scenes from the Gold Coast
Diagram of a train engine from the North British Locomotive Company, Glasgow

unittitle.title: Sankofa: Ghana's Illustrated Arts And Culture Magazine
The Verdict: Journal of The Revolutionary Organs

did.unittitle: Circulars issued by Judicial Adviser, Chief Commissioner and the Ashanti Judicial Adviser
Letters to the chairman of the Assets Committee Ghana
Democracy Watch (Newsletter of the Ghana Center for Democratic Development)
The Sunday Times Magazine (re Kwame Nkrumah)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises oversized posters published by the Department of Public Information Services, Accra, and arranged alphabetically by organization and/or title.

did.unittitle: District Assembly and Unit Committee Elections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poster includes names, photographs, party logos and affiliations of candidates nominated for presidency of Ghana in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: HIPC (Heavily Indebted Poor Countries) initiative was launched by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank in 1996 as an international response to provide debt relief to the neediest countries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Kofi Agyekum Kufuor was the second president of the Fourth Republic of Ghana (2001-2009).

did.unittitle: Printed material: stickers, pocket calendar, registration forms, Progressive People's Party (PPP) platform statement, Polling Station Data Booklet
Printed material for NPP Nana Akufo-Addo CD, Awurade Kae Nana , composed by Isaiah Kwadwo Ampong
Three shirts, NPP, Progressive People's Party (PPP), and National Democratic Congress (NDC)
Three fabric banners, NPP, NDC, and Convention People's Party (CPP)
Two baseball caps, NPP and NDC
NPP Nana Akufo-Addo CD, Awurade Kae Nana , composed by Isaiah Kwadwo Ampong [commercially produced]

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
